subclusters.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Brain Oxidative Stress Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage to macromolecules leading to aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial electron transport as primary ROS source and imbalance of ROS/antioxidants in aging.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS generation, oxidative damage accumulation, and dietary modulation of aging.
Describes ROS generated during metabolism causing cumulative damage, with hypoxia/reoxygenation increasing oxidative stress.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation, glutathione redox shifts, and caloric restriction effects on oxidative stress.
Describes ROS as causal agents of aging with accumulation of oxidative damage and imperfect antioxidant defenses.
Focuses on mitochondrial superoxide radicals causing damage and role of SOD enzymes in mitigating oxidative stress.
Describes ROS production, oxidative damage to biomolecules, and antioxidant enzymes modulating lifespan.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS generation, balance with scavenging enzymes, and genetic modulation of oxidative stress.
Links oxidative damage accumulation to aging and shows resistance to oxidative stress extends lifespan.
Focuses on mitochondrial membrane properties influencing ROS leakage and oxidative damage contributing to aging.
Details mitochondrial complexes as ROS sources and ROS-induced damage driving functional decline and aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production, sex differences in antioxidant defenses, and p53 role in oxidative stress and aging.
Focuses on metabolic oxidant by-products causing molecular damage and antioxidant defenses influencing aging and diseases.
Discusses accumulation of oxidative damage, antioxidant defenses, and DNA repair capacity modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Brain Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS generation in brain, lipid peroxidation as oxidative damage marker, and antioxidant enzyme changes in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Brain Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxygen free radicals causing lipid peroxidation, malondialdehyde as aging marker, and antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage-Driven Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced mitochondrial DNA mutations and vicious cycle of mtDNA damage and ROS production driving aging.
Describes oxidative stress causing cellular senescence, activation of senescence markers, and proinflammatory SASP contributing to aging.
Links chronic oxidative stress in immune cells to inflammation, NF-kappaB activation, neuroimmunomodulation, and aging.
Describes oxidative/nitrosative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, antioxidant impairment, and inflammation in accelerated aging and MDD.
Focuses on reactive oxygen intermediates dysregulation causing immunosenescence, chronic inflammation, and autoimmunity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Phase 2 Protein Induction and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress driving aging, decline in antioxidant capacity, and protective role of phase 2 protein induction via Nrf2.
Focuses on methionine sulfoxide reductase A repairing oxidized methionine and catalyzing antioxidant reactions to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Network Robustness and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging as breakdown of ROS network robustness, involving multiple subnetworks maintaining ROS homeostasis and delaying aging.
